actions.title: Section 301 China Tariffs Four Year Review - Increased Tariffs
actions.summary: Increased Section 301 tariffs on certain products from China following the four-year statutory review. Includes increases on tungsten products, wafers, and polysilicon to 25-50%. Effective January 1, 2025.
actions.raw_excerpt: Section 301 four-year review: increased tariffs on tungsten, wafers, polysilicon from China

actions.title: Sanctions on Russian Diamonds and Seafood
actions.summary: Import sanctions on diamonds and seafood products from Russia, implementing trade restrictions as part of broader Russia sanctions regime.
actions.raw_excerpt: Import sanctions on Russian diamonds and seafood products

actions.title: IEEPA Additional Duties on Imports from Canada (Initial - 25%/10% Energy)
actions.summary: Imposed 25% additional ad valorem duty on all products of Canada and 10% on Canadian energy/energy resources, effective February 4, 2025. Eliminated de minimis exemption for Canadian goods. This action was retracted the same day by CSMS #63991510 before being reimposed March 4.
actions.raw_excerpt: 9903.01.10: All imports of articles that are products of Canada...an additional ad valorem rate of duty of 25%. 9903.01.13: energy...10%.

actions.title: IEEPA Fentanyl Duties on Imports from China/Hong Kong (Initial - 10%)
actions.summary: Imposed 10% additional ad valorem duty on all products of China and Hong Kong effective February 4, 2025, pursuant to IEEPA Executive Order 14195 addressing synthetic opioid supply chain. Eliminated de minimis exemption for Chinese/HK goods. Includes products of Hong Kong per EO 13936.
actions.raw_excerpt: 9903.01.20: All imports of articles that are products of China and Hong Kong...an additional ad valorem rate of duty of 10%.

actions.title: Pause on Additional Duties on Imports from Canada
actions.summary: Per the President's direction, the IEEPA duties on imports from Canada under the February 1, 2025 Executive Order were retracted. CBP will not apply the additional duties at this time. Duties were later reimposed effective March 4, 2025 via CSMS #64297449.
actions.raw_excerpt: Per the President's direction, CSMS message 63988467 is retracted with respect to imports from Canada. CBP will not apply the additional duties.

actions.title: Updated Compliance Guidance for China/Hong Kong IEEPA Duties
actions.summary: Updated reporting and compliance guidance for the 10% IEEPA duties on China/Hong Kong. CBP will reject non-compliant entry summaries and requires duties to be properly associated to HTS 9903.01.20. Provides HTS reporting sequence instructions for stacking with Section 301, Section 232, and other duties.
actions.raw_excerpt: CBP will reject entry summaries that are not in compliance...including entry summaries filed without the required additional duties.

actions.title: IEEPA Additional Duties on Imports from Mexico (25%)
actions.summary: Imposed 25% additional ad valorem duty on all products of Mexico effective March 4, 2025, pursuant to EO 14194 addressing the situation at the southern border. De minimis exemption remains available for Mexico. Duties apply in addition to all other applicable duties including AD/CVD.
actions.raw_excerpt: 9903.01.01: All imports of articles that are products of Mexico...an additional ad valorem rate of duty of 25%.

actions.title: IEEPA Duties on Imports from Canada Reimposed (25%/10% Energy)
actions.summary: Reimposed 25% additional ad valorem duty on products of Canada and 10% on Canadian energy/energy resources, effective March 4, 2025. Supersedes the earlier pause. De minimis exemption remains available. Later increased to 35% effective August 1, 2025.
actions.raw_excerpt: 9903.01.10: All imports of articles that are products of Canada...an additional ad valorem rate of duty of 25%. 9903.01.13: energy...10%.

actions.title: IEEPA Fentanyl Duty on China/Hong Kong Increased to 20%
actions.summary: Increased the IEEPA fentanyl-related additional duty on products of China and Hong Kong from 10% to 20%, effective March 4, 2025, under new HTS heading 9903.01.24. The previous 10% rate under 9903.01.20 applied from February 4 through March 3, 2025 only.
actions.raw_excerpt: 9903.01.24: All imports of articles that are products of China and Hong Kong...an additional ad valorem rate of duty of 20%.

actions.title: Mexico Duties Update: USMCA Exemption and Potash Reduced Rate
actions.summary: Effective March 7, 2025, goods qualifying for USMCA are exempt from the 25% Mexico duties under new HTS 9903.01.04. Potash from Mexico qualifying for USMCA is also exempt; non-USMCA potash is subject to a reduced 10% duty (instead of 25%) under HTS 9903.01.05.
actions.duty_rate: USMCA goods exempt; Non-USMCA potash 10% (reduced from 25%)
actions.raw_excerpt: Effective March 7, 2025, goods that qualify for USMCA are exempt from the additional duty rates implemented March 4, 2025.

actions.title: Section 232 Import Duties on Aluminum and Aluminum Derivative Products
actions.summary: 25% tariff on aluminum imports from all countries under Section 232, eliminating previous country exemptions. Covers primary aluminum (Chapter 76) and derivative products. Proclamations 9704 and 10896.
actions.raw_excerpt: 25% Section 232 duties on aluminum and derivatives from all countries, no country exemptions

actions.title: Section 232 Import Duties on Steel and Steel Derivative Products
actions.summary: 25% tariff on steel imports from all countries under Section 232, eliminating previous country exemptions. Covers primary steel (Chapters 72, 73) and derivative products. Proclamations 9705 and 10895.
actions.raw_excerpt: 25% Section 232 duties on steel and derivatives from all countries, no country exemptions

actions.title: Section 232 Import Duties on Passenger Vehicles and Light Trucks
actions.summary: 25% tariff on imports of passenger vehicles and light trucks from all countries under Section 232, Proclamation 10908. Vehicles 25+ years old exempt. USMCA auto parts not subject until further process established.
actions.raw_excerpt: 25% Section 232 duty on passenger vehicles and light trucks from all countries, effective Apr 3 2025

actions.title: IEEPA Reciprocal Tariffs - 10% Baseline Effective April 5, 2025
actions.summary: Imposed a baseline 10% additional ad valorem reciprocal tariff on all imported goods under HTS 9903.01.25, effective April 5, 2025. Exceptions for Canada, Mexico, Column 2 countries, goods in transit, Annex II products, Section 232 goods, and articles with 20%+ US content. Drawback is available.
actions.raw_excerpt: 9903.01.25: Additional ad valorem duty rate of 10%. All imported goods, other than those that fall within the identified exceptions.

actions.title: Reciprocal Tariffs - Country-Specific Rates for 83 Countries (April 9)
actions.summary: Implemented country-specific reciprocal tariff rates for 83 countries effective April 9, 2025, replacing the 10% baseline. Rates range from 11% (Cameroon, DRC) to 50% (Lesotho). EU at 20%, Japan 24%, South Korea 25%, India 26%, China 34%, Vietnam 46%. These bespoke rates were later suspended back to 10% on May 14.
actions.duty_rate: 11%-50% country-specific (see Annex I); 10% baseline for non-listed
actions.raw_excerpt: Effective April 9, 2025, a country-specific ad valorem rate of duty will apply to imported goods of 83 countries, replacing the 10% rate.

actions.title: Reciprocal Tariff on China Increased to 84%
actions.summary: Updated the reciprocal tariff rate for goods of China (including Hong Kong and Macau) from 34% to 84% under HTS 9903.01.63, effective April 9, 2025. This was pursuant to an April 8, 2025 Executive Order. Rate was later further increased to 125% then suspended to 10%.
actions.federal_authority: Executive Order (Amendment to Reciprocal Tariffs), IEEPA
actions.raw_excerpt: 9903.01.63: Articles the product of China, including Hong Kong and Macau, will be assessed an additional ad valorem rate of duty of 84%.

actions.title: Section 232 Import Duties on Automobile Parts
actions.summary: 25% tariff on imports of certain automobile parts from all countries effective May 3, 2025 under Proclamation 10908. Parts eligible for USMCA preferential treatment exempt (9903.94.06). No drawback available.
actions.raw_excerpt: 25% Section 232 duty on certain auto parts from all countries; USMCA-eligible parts exempt

actions.title: China Reciprocal Tariff Reduced to 10% (90-Day Suspension)
actions.summary: Reduced the reciprocal tariff on products of China (including Hong Kong and Macau) from 125% to 10% for a 90-day suspension period effective May 14, 2025. Filers use 9903.01.25 instead of 9903.01.63. The separate IEEPA fentanyl duty of 20% on China/HK remains in effect.
actions.federal_authority: Executive Order (Modifying Reciprocal Tariff Rates - PRC Discussions), IEEPA
actions.duty_rate: 10% reciprocal (reduced from 125%); 20% IEEPA fentanyl still applies
actions.raw_excerpt: The 10% reciprocal tariff will replace the 125% reciprocal tariff for products of China. Filers will discontinue heading 9903.01.63.

actions.title: EO 14289 Tariff Stacking/Prioritization Rules (Retroactive to Mar 4)
actions.summary: Established tariff prioritization rules when articles are subject to multiple tariff actions: (1) 232 Auto/Auto Parts takes priority over IEEPA Canada/Mexico and 232 Steel/Aluminum; (2) IEEPA Canada/Mexico takes priority over 232 Steel/Aluminum; (3) USMCA-qualifying auto parts exempt from 232 Auto and IEEPA. Retroactive to March 4, 2025, with refund procedures available.
actions.duty_rate: Stacking prioritization: 232 Auto > IEEPA Canada/Mexico > 232 Steel/Aluminum
actions.raw_excerpt: For articles subject to more than one of the five tariff actions addressed in EO 14289, filers will pay duty per the prioritization.

actions.title: Updated List of Canadian Energy Products Subject to 10% Duty
actions.summary: Updated the list of commodities classified as energy and energy resources of Canada under HTS 9903.01.13 (subject to 10% additional duty instead of 25%). Provides a revised attachment fully replacing the previous March 24, 2025 list.
actions.raw_excerpt: Attached is an updated list of energy and energy resources of Canada, as defined by HTS 9903.01.13. Full replacement of previous list.

actions.title: Reciprocal Tariffs In-Transit Exception Extended to June 16, 2025
actions.summary: Extended the in-transit exception deadline for IEEPA reciprocal tariffs from May 27 to June 16, 2025. Goods loaded before April 5/9/10, 2025 and entered before June 16 may qualify for the in-transit exception under 9903.01.28 at the 10% rate. Temporary measure during CIT litigation stay.
actions.duty_rate: In-transit exception: 10% in lieu of country-specific rate
actions.raw_excerpt: CBP's updated guidance is that it is generally not realistic for shipments to qualify for the in-transit exceptions if entry is not made prior to June 16.

actions.title: Section 232 Additional Steel Derivative Products
actions.summary: Expanded list of steel derivative products subject to 25% Section 232 tariffs. Covers downstream steel products not included in the original proclamation.
actions.raw_excerpt: Updated guidance expanding list of steel derivative products subject to Section 232 duties

actions.title: 2025 United Kingdom Automobile Tariff Rate Quota
actions.summary: Tariff rate quota for automobile imports from the United Kingdom, providing preferential treatment for a limited quantity of UK-origin vehicles under the Section 232 auto tariff framework.
actions.raw_excerpt: Tariff rate quota for UK automobile imports under Section 232 framework

actions.title: Reciprocal Tariff Bespoke Rates Suspended Until August 1, 2025
actions.summary: Extended the suspension of country-specific bespoke reciprocal tariff rates (except China) until August 1, 2025. All covered countries remain at 10% baseline under 9903.01.25. China's bespoke rate separately suspended until August 12, 2025, also at 10%.
actions.federal_authority: Executive Order (Extending the Modification of Reciprocal Tariff Rates), IEEPA
actions.duty_rate: 10% (bespoke rates suspended; China also 10% until Aug 12)
actions.raw_excerpt: This EO extends the suspension of the country specific bespoke rates, except for products of China, until August 1, 2025.

actions.title: Section 232 Import Duties on Copper and Copper Derivative Products
actions.summary: 50% ad valorem tariff on copper content of semi-finished copper products and intensive copper derivative products from all countries. Duty applies to the copper content value specifically, with non-copper content at 0%. No drawback available.
actions.raw_excerpt: 50% Section 232 duty on copper content of semi-finished and derivative copper products

actions.title: Canada IEEPA Duties Increased to 35% (40% Anti-Transshipment)
actions.summary: Increased the IEEPA additional duty on products of Canada from 25% to 35% effective August 1, 2025 under HTS 9903.01.10. Energy resources remain at 10% under 9903.01.13. Introduced a new 40% anti-transshipment penalty rate under HTS 9903.01.16 for goods CBP determines were transshipped to evade duties.
actions.raw_excerpt: 9903.01.10: products of Canada...an additional ad valorem rate of duty of 35%. 9903.01.16: transshipped to evade...40%.

actions.title: IEEPA Additional Duties on Imports from Brazil (40%)
actions.summary: Imposed 40% additional ad valorem duty on all products of Brazil effective August 6, 2025, pursuant to EO 14323 addressing threats by the Government of Brazil. Applies in addition to reciprocal tariffs and all other duties except Section 232 duties. In-transit exception until October 5, 2025. Drawback is available.
actions.raw_excerpt: 9903.01.77: All imports of articles that are products of Brazil...will be assessed an additional ad valorem rate of duty of 40%.

actions.title: Reciprocal Tariff Country-Specific Rates Reimposed (August 7, 2025)
actions.summary: Reimposed country-specific reciprocal tariff rates under new HTS headings 9903.02.02-9903.02.71 effective August 7, 2025, replacing the suspended 10% baseline. EU rate set to a minimum 15% floor (zero reciprocal tariff for goods with Column 1 rate >= 15%). China remains at 10%. Introduced 40% anti-transshipment penalty under 9903.02.01.
actions.federal_authority: Executive Order 14257, as amended (IEEPA Reciprocal Tariff)
actions.duty_rate: Country-specific rates per Annex I; EU min 15% floor; China 10%; 40% transshipment penalty
actions.raw_excerpt: Imported goods of countries in Annex I are subject to HTSUS 9903.02.02-9903.02.71 and associated reciprocal tariffs effective August 7, 2025.

actions.title: China Reciprocal Tariff 10% Extended to November 10, 2025
actions.summary: Extended the suspension of China's bespoke reciprocal tariff rate (heading 9903.01.63), maintaining the 10% rate under 9903.01.25 until November 10, 2025. The separate IEEPA fentanyl duty of 20% on China/Hong Kong products remains in effect in addition to the 10% reciprocal rate.
actions.federal_authority: Executive Order (Further Modifying Reciprocal Tariff Rates - PRC), IEEPA
actions.duty_rate: 10% reciprocal (suspension extended); 20% IEEPA fentanyl still applies
actions.raw_excerpt: Heading 9903.01.63 will continue to be suspended until November 10, 2025. China products subject to reciprocal tariff of 10%.

actions.title: IEEPA Additional Duties on Imports from India (25%)
actions.summary: Imposed 25% additional ad valorem duty on all products of India effective August 27, 2025, pursuant to EO 14329 addressing threats related to India's importation of Russian oil. Applies in addition to reciprocal tariffs and all other duties. In-transit exception until September 17, 2025. Drawback is available.
actions.raw_excerpt: All imports of articles that are products of India...will be subject to an additional ad valorem rate of duty of 25%.

actions.title: Extension of Section 301 China Product Exclusions
actions.summary: 178 product exclusions from Section 301 China tariffs extended through November 10, 2026, following the trade and economic deal between the US and China. Covers specific products previously subject to additional Section 301 duties.
actions.raw_excerpt: 178 Section 301 China product exclusions extended through Nov 10, 2026

actions.title: Updated Product Exemptions from Reciprocal Tariffs (Annex II)
actions.summary: Updated the Annex II product exemption list for reciprocal tariffs effective September 8, 2025. Both additions and removals of products from the exemption list. Products filed under 9903.01.32. Establishes framework for trade and security agreements with authority granted to Commerce Secretary and USTR.
actions.federal_authority: Executive Order 14257, as amended (IEEPA Reciprocal Tariff)
actions.duty_rate: Exemption list update (products added/removed from Annex II)
actions.raw_excerpt: Annex II to EO 14257, as amended, lists products exempted from reciprocal tariffs. The amendments include both additions and removals.

actions.title: Section 301 Vessel Fees
actions.summary: New fee structure on vessels built in or owned/operated by Chinese entities calling at U.S. ports under Section 301. Updated October 10, 2025.
actions.raw_excerpt: Section 301 fees on Chinese-built or Chinese-operated vessels at US ports

actions.title: Section 232 Import Duties on Timber, Lumber, and Derivative Products
actions.summary: 10-25% tariffs on timber, lumber, and wood products from all countries under Section 232. Canadian softwood lumber under HS 4403.11 subject to 10% Section 232 tariff instead of 35% IEEPA. FTZ goods must enter under privileged foreign status.
actions.raw_excerpt: Section 232 duties of 10-25% on timber, lumber, and wood derivative products from all countries

actions.title: Section 232 Import Duties on Medium and Heavy-Duty Vehicles, Parts, and Buses
actions.summary: 10-25% additional tariffs on medium and heavy-duty vehicles (trucks), truck parts, and buses from all countries under Section 232. New HTSUS Subchapter 9903.74 created.
actions.raw_excerpt: Section 232 duties of 10-25% on trucks, truck parts, and buses from all countries

actions.title: China Tariff Rates Updated: Reciprocal 10% Extended to Nov 2026, Fentanyl Reduced to 10%
actions.summary: Extended the suspension of China's bespoke reciprocal tariff rate at 10% under 9903.01.25 until November 10, 2026. Separately reduced the IEEPA fentanyl duty on products of China/Hong Kong from 20% to 10% effective November 10, 2025, under 9903.01.24. Total IEEPA duties on China now 20% (10% reciprocal + 10% fentanyl).
actions.federal_authority: Executive Order (Modifying Reciprocal Tariff Rates - PRC Trade Arrangement), Executive Order (Modifying IEEPA Fentanyl Duties), IEEPA
actions.raw_excerpt: Reciprocal tariff 10% suspended until Nov 10, 2026. IEEPA Fentanyl duty lowered from 20% to 10% effective November 10, 2025.

actions.title: 237 Agricultural Products Exempted from Reciprocal Tariffs
actions.summary: Exempted 237 agricultural HTSUS classifications and 11 additional agricultural product categories from reciprocal tariffs, effective November 13, 2025. Products filed under 9903.01.32 or new heading 9903.02.78 for category-based exemptions. Includes refund procedures for previously overpaid duties.
actions.federal_authority: Executive Order (Modifying Scope of Reciprocal Tariff - Agricultural Products), EO 14257 as amended
actions.duty_rate: Exempt from reciprocal tariffs (237 HTSUS classifications + 11 categories)
actions.raw_excerpt: 237 agricultural HTSUS classifications and eleven additional categories of agricultural products are now exempt from reciprocal tariffs.

actions.title: 238 Agricultural Products Exempted from Brazil Tariffs
actions.summary: Exempted 238 agricultural HTSUS classifications and 11 additional agricultural product categories from the Brazil-specific IEEPA tariffs, effective November 13, 2025. Products filed under 9903.01.81 or new heading 9903.01.90. Includes refund procedures for previously overpaid duties.
actions.federal_authority: Executive Order (Modifying Scope of Brazil Tariffs), EO 14323 as amended
actions.duty_rate: Exempt from Brazil tariffs (238 HTSUS classifications + 11 categories)
actions.raw_excerpt: 238 agricultural HTSUS classifications and eleven additional categories of agricultural products are now exempt from Brazil tariffs.

actions.title: Tariff-Related Elements of US-Switzerland-Liechtenstein Agreement
actions.summary: Implementation of tariff-related elements of the framework agreement between the United States, Switzerland, and Liechtenstein. Provides guidance on HTS classification and duty treatment.
actions.raw_excerpt: Implementation of tariff framework agreement with Switzerland and Liechtenstein

actions.title: Section 301 Tariff Action on Semiconductors from China
actions.summary: New Section 301 action on semiconductors from China with initial tariff level of 0%, increasing in 18 months (June 23, 2027). Establishes framework for future semiconductor tariff escalation.
actions.raw_excerpt: Section 301 semiconductor tariff on China: 0% initial, increasing in 18 months

actions.title: Section 232 Import Duties on Semiconductors and Derivative Products
actions.summary: 25% tariff on a narrow set of advanced semiconductor imports and products containing those semiconductors under Section 232. Strict non-stacking rules exempt covered products from reciprocal and other Section 232 tariffs. No drawback permitted.
actions.raw_excerpt: 25% Section 232 duty on certain advanced semiconductors; non-stacking with other tariffs
